title: 113_hr1127
content: The Act may be cited as the "Rebuild American Manufacturing Act of 2013" and includes a National Manufacturing Strategy. The President must develop a national manufacturing strategy within 180 days of the Act's enactment, with biennial revisions thereafter. The strategy should include goals to increase manufacturing jobs in the US and identify emerging technologies. The national manufacturing strategy aims to strengthen US manufacturing competitiveness globally and focus on sectors where the US is most competitive. It includes surveys of US companies with manufacturing facilities abroad and federal agencies providing assistance to US manufacturers. The national manufacturing strategy includes assistance from various federal agencies to US manufacturers, a survey of US manufacturing goods and their production locations, and data on US employment in the manufacturing sector. The national manufacturing strategy evaluates the global competitiveness of US manufacturing by comparing policies, strategies, and productivity with other countries. The President must include recommendations in the strategy. The national manufacturing strategy must include recommendations for achieving its goals, such as actions by various stakeholders, improving government policies and coordination, and how Federal agencies can support the strategy. The President must adopt successful strategies from other countries and submit the national manufacturing strategy to Congress within 180 days of the Act's enactment and each time it is revised.
